intro: Portulaca amilis, commonly known as the Mexican snowball or yellow portulaca, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in the morning and close by midday. Its succulent leaves are fleshy and thick, adapted to store water in arid environments. Portulaca amilis thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers.
